intro.speaker: Gyral
intro.line: Turn around and get lost, swine! This land belongs to the Stonewall Knights! If you need a second notice, I'll write it down on your men's corpses!

intro.speaker: Dalen
intro.line: Ya-har! A pile of corpses could still outfight you sorry lot! This is our territory, and no one gives orders to the Riders of Dawn!

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: What do you make of that?

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Mercenaries, from the look. Rival bands squabbling over some petty matter. A common enough sight in these dark times, milord. But if it comes to bloodletting, the nearby villages will pay for it.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Then let's make sure it doesn't.

intro.speaker: Dalen
intro.line: Time to fertilize the fields, soldiers!

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Seems our best option is to end the fighting as quickly as possible. Allying ourselves with one side or the other would certainly expedite things.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: A band of riders or a band of knights... Time to make our choice.

battle.speaker: Gyral
battle.line: More sellswords? Ha! Your timing is right impeccable. I'll buy your steel and see you're well compensated for the trouble!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Well, Robin? Shall we back the knights?

battle.speaker: Dalen
battle.line: Ya-har! There's a sensible lad. Come fight with us, instead! I'll pay you twice what that fool would!

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: ...So it's neither, is it? Which means you aim to fight them both?

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: I should have known... Are you sure about this? There may be more of them in hiding, you know. ...But I'll leave the final choice to you.

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: So be it. Shepherds! To arms

recruit-talk.speaker: Panne
recruit-talk.line: That scent... It smells like... Ho! You there!

recruit-talk.speaker: Yarne
recruit-talk.line: Yeah, well so are— GODS! M-Mother?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Yarne
recruit-talk.line: Gah, you nearly gave me heart failure! I'd given up on EVER finding you! You wouldn't believe how dangerous it is here. All these swords and brigands... Anyway, I've found you. That makes the trip back in time more than worth it.

recruit-talk.speaker: Panne
recruit-talk.line: So you came with that man-spawn Lucina, did you? Hmm... Explain to me why my son consorts with common thugs?

recruit-talk.speaker: Yarne
recruit-talk.line: Huh? H-hey, I didn't have a choice in the matter! You were nowhere to be found, and roaming around alone is a recipe for... extinction. I'd figure I'd be safe if I took up with some strong allies, and so I... Wait, are you angry? Because you look kind of ang—

recruit-talk.speaker: Panne
recruit-talk.line: OF COURSE I AM ANGRY! No son of mine will survive by taking the path of the coward! You're coming with me, I'm going to teach you some taguel pride, starting right now!

recruit-talk.speaker: Yarne
recruit-talk.line: Gyah! D-don't surprise me like that! I could die of heart failure!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: ...I was standing right in front of you. Ought I have waved first, or would that have been too threatening?

recruit-talk.speaker: Yarne
recruit-talk.line: Oh, aren't we the jester! People die from much lesser things you know. It's no laughing matter! What if you scare me and I trip and fall and cut my head open? What then?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Er...right. Look, if you're so worried about death, maybe you should just surrender. I have no desire to spill unnecessary blood.

recruit-talk.speaker: Yarne
recruit-talk.line: Wait, surrender is an option?! Wh-why didn't you say so?!

visit.speaker: Elder
visit.line: Greetings, traveler. We're backers of the Stonewall Knights. Try this lance out. It'll put those dastard riders in their place!

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: Every time this lot has a go, our fields get trampled and our houses destroyed! Ain't no matter to us which side wins so long as it's over quickly. Here, then. Take this, and get those sorry lunkheads outta here!

visit.speaker: Maiden
visit.line: Our village suffered enough with one band of sellswords strutting about, but two?! Here! I'll give ya this if you just make 'em stop fighting!

visit.speaker: Elder
visit.line: Welcome, friend. We're supporters of the Riders of Dawn here. Take this hammer. It'll send those pesky knights running for the hills!

boss.speaker: Gyral
boss.line: You'll never breach the impenetrable forces of the Stonewall Knights!

boss.speaker: Dalen
boss.line: You'll never stop the unending march of the Riders of Dawn!

boss.speaker: Dalen
boss.line: I'll send your fat men and their fat-man armor sailing through the sky!

boss.speaker: Gyral
boss.line: Horse and rider both will be red smears across our shields!

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: The fighting is over, milord. That should spare the villages from any further damage.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Good. Thought I still don't understand why they had to fight in the first place.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Competition, milord. A sad consequence of this war. Farm the land, and your fields are pillaged. Open a shop, and your goods are stolen. It's little wonder men take up steel and become mercenaries. ...Or worse. There's only so much gold to go around, and so they fight for dominance.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Seems they'll continue to do so until it's safe to be a farmer or merchant again. All the more reason for us to end things as quickly as possible.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: Well put, milord. Shall we be on our way?

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: By the by, our erstwhile allies send their regards and a reward to match. War's an expensive proposition, but I wager blood money spends the same as any other. I'll see it's added to our tally.

end.speaker: Yarne
end.line: Gyah! Y-you scared me! Don't go sneaking up behind people! You'll give them whiplash...

end.speaker: Yarne
end.line: Yarne. Don't you remember? You're the one who gave it to me.

end.speaker: Yarne
end.line: Um, I'm a taguel, right? I kind of have to be.

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: I suppose blood does not lie. I am pleased to see you, my son. You represent a new hope for our race.

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: You are living proof that man and taguel can coexist.

end.speaker: Yarne
end.line: Hey, I didn't do anything special. I was just born. You're the one who proved all that bridging-the-gap stuff. You're the one who married a human. Er, thanks for doing that, by the way. Even if I can't take credit for it, I'm proud of my heritage.

end.speaker: Panne
end.line: It gladdens me to see my son value pride... May you keep it always.
